data.title: Technical College System of Georgia: Middle Georgia State University
data.text:
Technical College System of Georgia

Tuition

Technical College System of Georgia (TCSG) transfer students will pay Middle Georgia State’s in-state tuition plus institutional and technology fees. Current undergraduate tuition rates are posted here https://www.mga.edu/bursar/tuition-fees/index.php.

Accreditation & Designation

The BS in Information Technology program is accredited by the Computing Accreditation Commission of ABET, http://www.abet.org.

Through its Department of Information Technology, Middle Georgia State has been designated:

A National Center for Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense Education by the National Security Agency

A National Center of Digital Forensics - Academic Excellence by the U.S. Department of Defense Cyber Crime Center

MGA B.S. in Information Technology -- TCSG Transfer

The B.S. in Information Technology program includes seven concentrations: Cyber Forensics, Cybersecurity, Integrated Digital Media & Game Design, Network Technologies & Administration, Software Engineering, Data Analytics, and Web Applications Development. Eligible TCSG students interested in Middle Georgia State’s 4-year IT degree program will be able to seamlessly transfer their coursework (60 plus hours) and complete their degree face-to-face or fully online.

MGA has specific agreements with the following TCSG institutions:

Augusta Technical College - Cybersecurity

Central Georgia Technical College - Cybersecurity, IT Professional, Network Specialist, Computer Programming, Computer Support Specialist, Web Design & Development

Southern Crescent Technical College - Cybersecurity

Ogeechee Technical College - Cybersecurity

Gwinnett Technical College - Cybersecurity

Students from other TCSG institutions listed below should use the following course transfer guide:

Course Transfer Equivalency and Approved Transfer Courses
